summary: This is an email chain from April 2021 among FBI personnel coordinating logistics for FBI agents to assist with the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details the schedule for agents to monitor Maxwell and her defense team during their review of evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse from April 13-15, 2021, and mentions the involvement of AUSA Maurene Comey and SOS Kimberly Meder.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: She is the AUSA who will be present all three days for the evidence review with Maxwell and her defense team at 500 Pearl Street. She will meet the agents there.

persons.name: Kimberly Meder
persons.context: She is mentioned as being present all three days for the evidence review, has been working the Maxwell case, and is familiar with everything. Agents are encouraged to reach out to her.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Addressed in an email providing an updated list of agents available to assist on the specified dates. Likely an FBI coordinator.

connections.description: Both are involved in the logistical coordination and supervision of the evidence review for the Maxwell case at 500 Pearl Street.
FBI agents are tasked with pulling Maxwell from Marshal custody, monitoring her throughout the evidence review day, and escorting her to the bathroom.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team begin reviewing evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse, monitored by FBI agents and supervised by AUSA Maurene Comey.

events.title: Scheduled Evidence Review Days
events.description: A three-day schedule from April 13 to 15, 2021, for Maxwell's defense team to review evidence at 500 Pearl Street, with FBI agents providing security and logistical support.

locations: 5th floor proffer room area (500 Pearl Street)
keyFacts: The email coordinates FBI agent support for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review evidence from April 13-15, 2021, at 500 Pearl Street in New York.
FBI agents are required to have a handcuff key and are responsible for pulling Maxwell from Marshal custody and monitoring her throughout the day, including bathroom escorts.
AUSA Maurene Comey and SOS Kimberly Meder, who is familiar with the case, will be present to supervise the evidence review process.
The evidence is being transported and secured by an evidence unit, and the review sessions are scheduled to last from approximately 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM each day.
The communication highlights the extensive security and logistical preparations involved in facilitating Maxwell's access to evidence while she is in custody.
